noun.description: A house, especially a farmhouse, and outbuildings.
(as provided by the federal Homestead Act of 1862) an area of public land in the West (usually 160 acres) granted to any US citizen willing to settle on and farm the land for at least five years.

proper noun.description: An agricultural and suburban city in southeastern Florida, southwest of Miami; population 57,936 (est. 2008).

origin: Old English hāmstede a settlement (see home, stead).
